app.lem: Das Ludwigslied
app.rdg: The Lay of Ludwig

app.lem: Einan kuning uueiz ih. Heizsit her hluduig.
app.rdg: I know a king, Ludwig is his name

app.lem: Ther gerno gode thionot. Ih uueiz her Imos lonot.
app.rdg: Who gladly serves god. I know it was worthwhile for him.

app.lem: Kind uuarth her faterlos. Thes uuarth Imo sar buoz
app.rdg: As a child he was fatherless. There was a replacement for him

app.lem: Holoda Inan truhtin. Magaczogo uuarth her sin.
app.rdg: The lord himself helped him and was his guardian.

app.lem: Gab her imo dugidi. Fronisc gi-thigini.
app.rdg: He gave Ludwig companions, a kingly entourage,

app.lem: Stuol hier In urankon. So bruche her es lango
app.rdg: The throne of the Franks, For a long time he rejoiced in these gifts!

app.lem: Thaz gi-deilder thanne. Sar mit karlemanne.
app.rdg: The Lordship was shared with Karlmann,

app.lem: Bruoder sinemo. Thia czala uuunniono.
app.rdg: his brother, the sum of the pleasures.

app.lem: So thaz uuarth al gendiot. Koron uuolda sin god.
app.rdg: After this was accomplished. God would test him [to see if]

l.app: Ob her arbeidi. So Iung tholon mahti. if he could endure hardship while so young </app

app.lem: Lietz her heidine man. Ober seo lidan.
app.rdg: He let heathens come over the sea,

app.lem: Thiot urancono. Manon sun-diono.
app.rdg: so the Franks would pay for their sins.

app.lem: Sume sar uer-lorane. Uuurdun sum erkorane .
app.rdg: Some would be lost immediately, others would be chosen for eternal salvation

app.lem: Haranskara tholota. Ther er misselebeta .
app.rdg: Severe punishments must be suffered by those who have lived in sin.

app.lem: Ther ther thanne thiob uuas. Ind er thanana ginas.
app.rdg: Those who had been thieves began to fast,

app.lem: Nam sina uaston. Sidh uuarth her guot man.
app.rdg: in this way they saved themselves and became good people.

app.lem: Sum uuas luginari. Sum skachari .
app.rdg: Another was a liar, another a robber

app.lem: Sum fol loses. Ind er gi-buozta sih thes.
app.rdg: a third lived without any control.

app.lem: Kuning uuas er-uirrit. Thaz richi al girrit.
Uuas er-bolgan krist. Leidhor thes Ingald iz.
app.rdg: The holy Christ was full of wrath. The kingdom must atone for this!

app.lem: Thoh er-barmedes got. Uuuisser alla thia not.
app.rdg: But God was also full of mercy. He knew how dangerous it was

app.lem: Hiez her hluduigan. Tharot sar ritan.
app.rdg: so he commanded Ludwig,

app.lem: Hluduig kuning min. Hilph · minan liutin.
app.rdg: “Ludwig my king, help my people!

app.lem: Heigun sa north-man. Harto bi-duuungan.
app.rdg:
They are so oppressed by the Northmen!”
north-man can be translated as normans or northmen, but in this case it is a reference to the vikings (who came from the north)

app.lem: Thanne sprah hluduig. Herro so duon ih.
app.rdg: Ludwig replied “Lord,

app.lem: Dot ni rette mir iz. Al thaz . thu gibiudist.
app.rdg: if death does not hinder me, I will do all that you command”

app.lem: Tho nam her godes urlub. Huob her gundfanon uf.
app.rdg: he obeyed his God, he raised the war banner

app.lem: Reit her thara In urankon. Ingagan north-mannon.
app.rdg: and rode against the northmen in the land of the Franks.

app.lem: Gode thancodun. The sin bei-dodun.
app.rdg: God was thankful, having awaited him.

app.lem: Quadhun al fro min. So lango bei-don uuir thin.
app.rdg: All said: “Lord, we have waited so long for you!”

app.lem: Thanne sprah luto. Hluduig ther guoto.
app.rdg: But with a louder voice Ludwig said

app.lem: Trostet hiu gi-selleon. Mine not-stallon.
app.rdg: “Congratulations to you, my companions in arms and my friends,

app.lem: Hera santa mih god. Ioh mir selbo gibod
app.rdg: God sent me and commanded me himself

app.lem: Ob hiu rat thuhti. Thaz ih hier ge-uuhti.
app.rdg: to fight here if it would help you

app.lem: Mih selbon ni sparoti. Un-c ih hiu gi-neriti .
app.rdg: and not to spare me till I have saved you.

app.lem: Nu uuill ih thaz mir uolgon. Alle godes holdon.
app.rdg: Now it is my wish that all of you who stand in god’s grace will follow me.

app.lem: Gi-skerit ist thiu hier-uuist. So lango so uuili krist.
app.rdg: Our earthly being is measured according to the will of holy Christ.

app.lem: Uuili her unsa hina-uarth. Thero habet her giuualt.
app.rdg: If he wants our death, he has that power.

app.lem: So uuer so hier In ellian. Gi-duot godes uuillion.
app.rdg: I shall reward whoever bravely accomplishes god’s will,

app.lem: Quimit he gi-sund uz. Ih gi-lonon Imoz.
app.rdg: Should they survive the battle. If he falls in battle,

app.lem: Bilibit her thar Inne. Sinemo kunnie.
app.rdg: I shall give the reward to his relatives

app.lem: Tho nam her skild Indi sper. Ellianlicho reit her.
app.rdg: At this he took a shield and a spear.

app.lem: Uuolder uuar er-rah-chon. Sina uuidar-sah-chon.
app.rdg: He rode bravely ahead. He wanted to speak clearly with his enemy.

app.lem: Tho ni uuas iz buro-lang. Fand her thia north-man
app.rdg: After a short time he came across the northmen.

app.lem: Gode lob sageda. Her sihit thes her gereda.
app.rdg: He praised God, now he shall see what he desires!

app.lem: Ther kuning reit kuono. Sang lioth frano.
app.rdg: The King burst forth, a sacred song on his lips,

app.lem: Ioh alle saman sungun. Kirrie-leison.
app.rdg: and his men all together sang “Kyrie Eleison”.

app.lem: Sang uuas gi-sungan. Uuig uuas bi-gunnan.
app.rdg: The song was sung, the battle was begun.

app.lem: Bluot skein In uuangon. Spilodun ther urankon.
app.rdg: The blood shone in their cheeks, and the Franks joyfully chased [the enemy].

app.lem: Thar uaht thegeno gelih. Nichein soso hluduig.
app.rdg: Every warrior fought, but non like Ludwig,

app.lem: Snel Indi kuoni. Thaz uuas Imo gekunni
app.rdg: so brave and so bold? He was born for it.

app.lem: Suman thuruh-skluog her. Suman thuruh-stah her.
app.rdg: He pierced one, he stabbed another.

app.lem: Her skancta ce hanton. Sinan fianton
app.rdg: Without rest he poured out his enemy’s

app.lem: Bitteres lides. So uue hin hio thes libes.
app.rdg: bitter drink. Woe to their lives!

app.lem: Gilobot si thiu godes kraft. Hluduig uuarth sigihaft
[I]oh allen heiligon thanc. Sin uuarth ther sigi-kamf
[U]uolar abur hluduig. Kuning u[n]s[er] fralig.
[S]o garo so-s er hio uuas. So uuar so-s es thurft uuas.
Gi-halde inan thruhtin. Bi sinan ergrehtin.
